text: President Trump emphasizes “race-neutral” methods to place students, rescinding Obama administration guidance on using race to promote diversity.
A federal court rules a law banning Mexican American Studies in Tucson, Ariz., schools was racist and unconstitutional.
Supreme Court limits the constitutionality of considering race when admitting students to public schools, in a blow to voluntary school desegregation.
Nation’s first charter school opens in St. Paul, Minn.
Supreme Court says it’s illegal for states to deny students public education on the basis of their immigration status.
Riots break out in high schools in Boston after judge orders busing to desegregate public schools.
Supreme Court rules in San Antonio v. Rodriguez that education is not a “fundamental right,” affirming the constitutionality of property-tax-based funding for schools.
Supreme Court rules schools can use busing, magnet schools and other tools to further integrate schools in all-white neighborhoods.
The nation’s first bilingual and bicultural public school opens in Miami to accommodate Cuban refugee children.
Flint, Mich., is first district to permanently place police officer in public school.
The National Guard is called to protect nine Black students integrating an all-white high school in Little Rock, Ark.
Supreme Court rules separate schools are “inherently unequal” in Brown v. Board of Education.
Los Angeles court says educating Mexican children in separate schools is unconstitutional.
Gong Lum v. Rice ruling says states can deem Chinese students as nonwhite when segregating public schools.
Supreme Court rules states can tax all citizens, even if they provide no high school for Black boys.
Plessy v. Ferguson sets legal precedent for “separate but equal” policies used to justify segregated schools.
What’s believed to be the nation’s first Black public secondary school opens in a church basement in Washington, D.C.
Lincoln signs the Emancipation Proclamation, freeing enslaved people in the U.S.
The first Indian boarding school to assimilate Native Americans opens on the Yakima Reservation.
Congress passes the Bill of Rights. The Tenth Amendment lays the foundation for state control of education.
South Carolina passes one of America’s first laws that shut out slaves from schooling.
